<<<<<<< HEAD
An essay concerning the Sabbath, or, The Sabbath-days rest from controversie wherein is asserted that our Christian Sabbath, Lords-day, or Sunday is the very same day of the week which was anciently observed by the Jews and Gentiles for the solemn day of their solemn weekly worship, before Israels coming out of Ægypt and after that by gentiles : prefaced, with an introduction thereunto touching the true meaning of Gen. 2 v, 2, 3 / by N. Homes. Homes, Nathanael, 1599-1678.
[12], 141 p.
Printed for the author, London : 1673.
Epistle to the reader signed: Nathanael Homes. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
=======

Homes. Homes, Nathanael, 1599-1678.
[12], 141 p.
Printed for the author, London : 1673.
Epistle to the reader signed: Nathanael Homes. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
